messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] House cleaning.....
messages.msgSnippet: Sent from my iPhone ... My mental well-being requires a reasonable amount of tidiness. I can t stand dirt or clutter. With that said, I can t organize a closet
messages.messageBody:
Sent from my iPhone

On Apr 11, 2012, at 9:08 AM, "Sarah" <sunflowermorning31@...> wrote:

> please tell me that you traded in your ideas of a tidy house when you had children lol.
> I just dont know how people do it, to be honest. I cant keep my house dust free, and I dont even know if I really want to at this point. lol. But that being said, do any of you follow any kind of cleaning regimn? We just cant , were so busy and moving and grooving, that when were home, I just wanna be home, not cleaning it. I do the dishes and try to throw a load of laundry in through the day..but other then that...I also clean a room when I feel moved lol. Maybe I am just anti cleaning ...I dont know. The kids also are amazing at putting away their things, which I am truly blessed for..but what about the deep cleaning like tha under the stove stuff lol. Do you guys choose a day and just
>
My mental well-being requires a reasonable amount of tidiness. I can't stand dirt or clutter. With that said, I can't organize a closet for the life of me, so please don't look!

I've used a semi- fly lady approach for about 15 years. Things changed when I had children. Mine are still young, 2 and 4. It's been hard, but we've found some balance. I do have high standards in certain rooms, and I'm trying to cultivate a neat and clean habit in my kids so it just seems natural to them.

Check out the fly lady. 30 minutes a day maintenance is possible.

I do take out my stove every few months, as I do the frig. I try to deep clean one room a month, on rotation. I usually do this when the kids are busy with their dad and want nothing to do with me.



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] House cleaning.....
messages.msgSnippet: -=-what about the deep cleaning like tha under the stove stuff lol. Do you guys choose a day and just go nuts?-=- I wait until it matters, or the stove has to
messages.messageBody:
-=-what about the deep cleaning like tha under the stove stuff lol. Do you guys choose a day and just go nuts?-=-

I wait until it matters, or the stove has to be moved anyway.

My house has been increasingly cleaner as my kids have gotten older.
Sometimes when I worried about it, I thought of people having lived in sod houses, or cabins with dirt floors. :-)

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: House cleaning.....
messages.msgSnippet: please tell me that you traded in your ideas of a tidy house when you had children lol. I just dont know how people do it, to be honest. I cant keep my house
messages.messageBody:
please tell me that you traded in your ideas of a tidy house when you had children lol.
I just dont know how people do it, to be honest. I cant keep my house dust free, and I dont even know if I really want to at this point. lol. But that being said, do any of you follow any kind of cleaning regimn? We just cant , were so busy and moving and grooving, that when were home, I just wanna be home, not cleaning it. I do the dishes and try to throw a load of laundry in through the day..but other then that...I also clean a room when I feel moved lol. Maybe I am just anti cleaning ...I dont know. The kids also are amazing at putting away their things, which I am truly blessed for..but what about the deep cleaning like tha under the stove stuff lol. Do you guys choose a day and just go nuts?
looking forward to discussing this.
Brightest Blessings
Sarah
